page.title: 04HOUSING IN LLANGYNIDR
page.content: LLANGYNIDR IS A VERY OLD VILLAGE WITH EVIDENCE OF ROMAN INHABITATION. THERE ARE AT PRESENT TWO DIFFERENT PARTS OF THE VILLAGE, THERE ARE SOME VERY OLD HOUSES, A TYTHE BARN AND A MILL HAVE BEEN CONVERTED INTO HOMES. ALONGSIDE THE OLD PART OF THE VILLAGE SEVERAL NEW ESTATES HAVE SPRUNG UP. THERE ARE 6 ESTATES IN LLANGYNIDR WITH A TOTAL OF 182 NEW HOUSES. THE HOUSES ARE MAINLY DETACHED, WITH SOME FLATS AND MAISONETTES. THERE ARE ALSO MANY HOLIDAY COTTAGES WHICH ARE EITHER USED BY THE OWNERS DURING HOLIDAY TIMES, OR LET IN THE SUMMER TO TOURISTS. MANY OLD COTTAGES HAVE BEEN RENOVATED AND MODERNISED. THE OLD SCHOOL HAS RECENTLY BEEN CONVERTED INTO FLATS AND TWO NEW HOUSES HAVE ALSO BEEN BUILT ON ITS SITE. THERE ARE MANY FARMS AROUND THE LLANGYNIDR AREA AS IT IS AN AGRICULTURAL REGION.
